pros: it was a great experience to work at amolf
cons: work vs life balance is very poor

review_title: Great opportunities for a researcher in physics
pros:
With a very good organization and competent personnel, FOM provides plenty of opportunities to acquire useful skills and have more solid basis for the future career (courses, orientation, ...).
Yearly meetings are organized to allow all researchers to share their results and do networking, excellent working conditions, real interest for your personal path.
cons: Difficult to determine. In some circumstances there can be some overlap between requirements from FOM and graduate schools, especially in the courses to follow, but it is not a real problem.

pros:
Surrounded by outstanding researchers, on par with top physics institutes around the world

Great support staff 

Steep learning curve: in house amolf training is also focused on presentation skills 

International and ambitious environment

You get paid for getting your PhD
cons: Not much, simply a great place to start your career

review_title: Lots of room to develop yourself and helpful back-office
pros: I have the feeling FOM really invests in my development. Back-office is friendly, approachable and efficient. Much better than at universities I've seen.
cons: Growth is only possible by leaving after a PhD. The organization will change radically in the near future

review_title: Great employer. Great to do a high-level PhD and launch your career.
pros:
- caring for employees
- various trainings
- good salary
cons:
- you are placed at the University site
- a lot of contact with FOM is about organization, not about the research project

pros:
- Spend grant money with relative freedom
- No oversight committee, all done by supervisors
cons: Have to go cross-country for the few official things you have to join.

review_title: Good place to work for research
pros: Very nice people. Very supportive for creative ideas.
cons: Cannot have a permanent position easily.
